001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of
003// the WPILib BSD license file in the root directory of this project.
004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable;
008import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableBuilder;
009import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableRegistry;
010import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotState;
011import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Timer;
012import java.util.Enumeration;
013
014/**
015 * The Command class is at the very core of the entire command framework. Every command can be
016 * started with a call to {@link Command#start() start()}. Once a command is started it will call
017 * {@link Command#initialize() initialize()}, and then will repeatedly call {@link Command#execute()
018 * execute()} until the {@link Command#isFinished() isFinished()} returns true. Once it does, {@link
019 * Command#end() end()} will be called.
020 *
021 * <p>However, if at any point while it is running {@link Command#cancel() cancel()} is called, then
022 * the command will be stopped and {@link Command#interrupted() interrupted()} will be called.
023 *
024 * <p>If a command uses a {@link Subsystem}, then it should specify that it does so by calling the
025 * {@link Command#requires(Subsystem) requires(...)} method in its constructor. Note that a Command
026 * may have multiple requirements, and {@link Command#requires(Subsystem) requires(...)} should be
027 * called for each one.
028 *
029 * <p>If a command is running and a new command with shared requirements is started, then one of two
030 * things will happen. If the active command is interruptible, then {@link Command#cancel()
031 * cancel()} will be called and the command will be removed to make way for the new one. If the
032 * active command is not interruptible, the other one will not even be started, and the active one
033 * will continue functioning.
034 *
035 * <p>This class is provided by the OldCommands VendorDep
036 *
037 * @see Subsystem
038 * @see CommandGroup
039 * @see IllegalUseOfCommandException
040 */
041public abstract class Command implements Sendable, AutoCloseable {
042  /** The time since this command was initialized. */
043  private double m_startTime = -1;
044
045  /** The time (in seconds) before this command "times out" (or -1 if no timeout). */
046  private double m_timeout = -1;
047
048  /** Whether or not this command has been initialized. */
049  private boolean m_initialized;
050
051  /** The required subsystems. */
052  private final Set m_requirements = new Set();
053
054  /** Whether or not it is running. */
055  private boolean m_running;
056
057  /** Whether or not it is interruptible. */
058  private boolean m_interruptible = true;
059
060  /** Whether or not it has been canceled. */
061  private boolean m_canceled;
062
063  /** Whether or not it has been locked. */
064  private boolean m_locked;
065
066  /** Whether this command should run when the robot is disabled. */
067  private boolean m_runWhenDisabled;
068
069  /** Whether or not this command has completed running. */
070  private boolean m_completed;
071
072  /** The {@link CommandGroup} this is in. */
073  private CommandGroup m_parent;
074
075  /** Creates a new command. The name of this command will be set to its class name. */
076  public Command() {
077    String name = getClass().getName();
078    SendableRegistry.add(this, name.substring(name.lastIndexOf('.') + 1));
079  }
080
081  /**
082   * Creates a new command with the given name.
083   *
084   * @param name the name for this command
085   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if name is null
086   */
087  public Command(String name) {
088    if (name == null) {
089      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Name must not be null.");
090    }
091    SendableRegistry.add(this, name);
092  }
093
094  /**
095   * Creates a new command with the given timeout and a default name. The default name is the name
096   * of the class.
097   *
098   * @param timeout the time (in seconds) before this command "times out"
099   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if given a negative timeout
100   * @see Command#isTimedOut() isTimedOut()
101   */
102  public Command(double timeout) {
103    this();
104    if (timeout < 0) {
105      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Timeout must not be negative.  Given:" + timeout);
106    }
107    m_timeout = timeout;
108  }
109
110  /**
111   * Creates a new command with the given timeout and a default name. The default name is the name
112   * of the class.
113   *
114   * @param subsystem the subsystem that this command requires
115   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if given a negative timeout
116   * @see Command#isTimedOut() isTimedOut()
117   */
118  public Command(Subsystem subsystem) {
119    this();
120    requires(subsystem);
121  }
122
123  /**
124   * Creates a new command with the given name.
125   *
126   * @param name the name for this command
127   * @param subsystem the subsystem that this command requires
128   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if name is null
129   */
130  public Command(String name, Subsystem subsystem) {
131    this(name);
132    requires(subsystem);
133  }
134
135  /**
136   * Creates a new command with the given timeout and a default name. The default name is the name
137   * of the class.
138   *
139   * @param timeout the time (in seconds) before this command "times out"
140   * @param subsystem the subsystem that this command requires
141   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if given a negative timeout
142   * @see Command#isTimedOut() isTimedOut()
143   */
144  public Command(double timeout, Subsystem subsystem) {
145    this(timeout);
146    requires(subsystem);
147  }
148
149  /**
150   * Creates a new command with the given name and timeout.
151   *
152   * @param name the name of the command
153   * @param timeout the time (in seconds) before this command "times out"
154   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if given a negative timeout or name was null.
155   * @see Command#isTimedOut() isTimedOut()
156   */
157  public Command(String name, double timeout) {
158    this(name);
159    if (timeout < 0) {
160      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Timeout must not be negative.  Given:" + timeout);
161    }
162    m_timeout = timeout;
163  }
164
165  /**
166   * Creates a new command with the given name and timeout.
167   *
168   * @param name the name of the command
169   * @param timeout the time (in seconds) before this command "times out"
170   * @param subsystem the subsystem that this command requires
171   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if given a negative timeout
172   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if given a negative timeout or name was null.
173   * @see Command#isTimedOut() isTimedOut()
174   */
175  public Command(String name, double timeout, Subsystem subsystem) {
176    this(name, timeout);
177    requires(subsystem);
178  }
179
180  @Override
181  public void close() {
182    SendableRegistry.remove(this);
183  }
184
185  /**
186   * Sets the timeout of this command.
187   *
188   * @param seconds the timeout (in seconds)
189   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if seconds is negative
190   * @see Command#isTimedOut() isTimedOut()
191   */
192  protected final synchronized void setTimeout(double seconds) {
193    if (seconds < 0) {
194      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Seconds must be positive.  Given:" + seconds);
195    }
196    m_timeout = seconds;
197  }
198
199  /**
200   * Returns the time since this command was initialized (in seconds). This function will work even
201   * if there is no specified timeout.
202   *
203   * @return the time since this command was initialized (in seconds).
204   */
205  public final synchronized double timeSinceInitialized() {
206    return m_startTime < 0 ? 0 : Timer.getFPGATimestamp() - m_startTime;
207  }
208
209  /**
210   * This method specifies that the given {@link Subsystem} is used by this command. This method is
211   * crucial to the functioning of the Command System in general.
212   *
213   * <p>Note that the recommended way to call this method is in the constructor.
214   *
215   * @param subsystem the {@link Subsystem} required
216   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if subsystem is null
217   * @throws IllegalUseOfCommandException if this command has started before or if it has been given
218   *     to a {@link CommandGroup}
219   * @see Subsystem
220   */
221  protected synchronized void requires(Subsystem subsystem) {
222    validate("Can not add new requirement to command");
223    if (subsystem != null) {
224      m_requirements.add(subsystem);
225    } else {
226      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Subsystem must not be null.");
227    }
228  }
229
230  /**
231   * Called when the command has been removed. This will call {@link Command#interrupted()
232   * interrupted()} or {@link Command#end() end()}.
233   */
234  synchronized void removed() {
235    if (m_initialized) {
236      if (isCanceled()) {
237        interrupted();
238        _interrupted();
239      } else {
240        end();
241        _end();
242      }
243    }
244    m_initialized = false;
245    m_canceled = false;
246    m_running = false;
247    m_completed = true;
248  }
249
250  /**
251   * The run method is used internally to actually run the commands.
252   *
253   * @return whether or not the command should stay within the {@link Scheduler}.
254   */
255  synchronized boolean run() {
256    if (!m_runWhenDisabled && m_parent == null && RobotState.isDisabled()) {
257      cancel();
258    }
259    if (isCanceled()) {
260      return false;
261    }
262    if (!m_initialized) {
263      m_initialized = true;
264      startTiming();
265      _initialize();
266      initialize();
267    }
268    _execute();
269    execute();
270    return !isFinished();
271  }
272
273  /** The initialize method is called the first time this Command is run after being started. */
274  protected void initialize() {}
275
276  /** A shadow method called before {@link Command#initialize() initialize()}. */
277  @SuppressWarnings("MethodName")
278  void _initialize() {}
279
280  /** The execute method is called repeatedly until this Command either finishes or is canceled. */
281  @SuppressWarnings("MethodName")
282  protected void execute() {}
283
284  /** A shadow method called before {@link Command#execute() execute()}. */
285  @SuppressWarnings("MethodName")
286  void _execute() {}
287
288  /**
289   * Returns whether this command is finished. If it is, then the command will be removed and {@link
290   * Command#end() end()} will be called.
291   *
292   * <p>It may be useful for a team to reference the {@link Command#isTimedOut() isTimedOut()}
293   * method for time-sensitive commands.
294   *
295   * <p>Returning false will result in the command never ending automatically. It may still be
296   * canceled manually or interrupted by another command. Returning true will result in the command
297   * executing once and finishing immediately. We recommend using {@link InstantCommand} for this.
298   *
299   * @return whether this command is finished.
300   * @see Command#isTimedOut() isTimedOut()
301   */
302  protected abstract boolean isFinished();
303
304  /**
305   * Called when the command ended peacefully. This is where you may want to wrap up loose ends,
306   * like shutting off a motor that was being used in the command.
307   */
308  protected void end() {}
309
310  /** A shadow method called after {@link Command#end() end()}. */
311  @SuppressWarnings("MethodName")
312  void _end() {}
313
314  /**
315   * Called when the command ends because somebody called {@link Command#cancel() cancel()} or
316   * another command shared the same requirements as this one, and booted it out.
317   *
318   * <p>This is where you may want to wrap up loose ends, like shutting off a motor that was being
319   * used in the command.
320   *
321   * <p>Generally, it is useful to simply call the {@link Command#end() end()} method within this
322   * method, as done here.
323   */
324  protected void interrupted() {
325    end();
326  }
327
328  /** A shadow method called after {@link Command#interrupted() interrupted()}. */
329  @SuppressWarnings("MethodName")
330  void _interrupted() {}
331
332  /**
333   * Called to indicate that the timer should start. This is called right before {@link
334   * Command#initialize() initialize()} is, inside the {@link Command#run() run()} method.
335   */
336  private void startTiming() {
337    m_startTime = Timer.getFPGATimestamp();
338  }
339
340  /**
341   * Returns whether or not the {@link Command#timeSinceInitialized() timeSinceInitialized()} method
342   * returns a number which is greater than or equal to the timeout for the command. If there is no
343   * timeout, this will always return false.
344   *
345   * @return whether the time has expired
346   */
347  protected synchronized boolean isTimedOut() {
348    return m_timeout != -1 && timeSinceInitialized() >= m_timeout;
349  }
350
351  /**
352   * Returns the requirements (as an {@link Enumeration Enumeration} of {@link Subsystem
353   * Subsystems}) of this command.
354   *
355   * @return the requirements (as an {@link Enumeration Enumeration} of {@link Subsystem
356   *     Subsystems}) of this command
357   */
358  synchronized Enumeration<?> getRequirements() {
359    return m_requirements.getElements();
360  }
361
362  /** Prevents further changes from being made. */
363  synchronized void lockChanges() {
364    m_locked = true;
365  }
366
367  /**
368   * If changes are locked, then this will throw an {@link IllegalUseOfCommandException}.
369   *
370   * @param message the message to say (it is appended by a default message)
371   */
372  synchronized void validate(String message) {
373    if (m_locked) {
374      throw new IllegalUseOfCommandException(
375          message + " after being started or being added to a command group");
376    }
377  }
378
379  /**
380   * Sets the parent of this command. No actual change is made to the group.
381   *
382   * @param parent the parent
383   * @throws IllegalUseOfCommandException if this {@link Command} already is already in a group
384   */
385  synchronized void setParent(CommandGroup parent) {
386    if (m_parent != null) {
387      throw new IllegalUseOfCommandException(
388          "Can not give command to a command group after already being put in a command group");
389    }
390    lockChanges();
391    m_parent = parent;
392  }
393
394  /**
395   * Returns whether the command has a parent.
396   *
397   * @return true if the command has a parent.
398   */
399  synchronized boolean isParented() {
400    return m_parent != null;
401  }
402
403  /**
404   * Clears list of subsystem requirements. This is only used by {@link ConditionalCommand} so
405   * canceling the chosen command works properly in {@link CommandGroup}.
406   */
407  protected void clearRequirements() {
408    m_requirements.clear();
409  }
410
411  /**
412   * Starts up the command. Gets the command ready to start.
413   *
414   * <p>Note that the command will eventually start, however it will not necessarily do so
415   * immediately, and may in fact be canceled before initialize is even called.
416   *
417   * @throws IllegalUseOfCommandException if the command is a part of a CommandGroup
418   */
419  public synchronized void start() {
420    lockChanges();
421    if (m_parent != null) {
422      throw new IllegalUseOfCommandException(
423          "Can not start a command that is a part of a command group");
424    }
425    Scheduler.getInstance().add(this);
426    m_completed = false;
427  }
428
429  /**
430   * This is used internally to mark that the command has been started. The lifecycle of a command
431   * is:
432   *
433   * <p>startRunning() is called. run() is called (multiple times potentially) removed() is called.
434   *
435   * <p>It is very important that startRunning and removed be called in order or some assumptions of
436   * the code will be broken.
437   */
438  synchronized void startRunning() {
439    m_running = true;
440    m_startTime = -1;
441  }
442
443  /**
444   * Returns whether or not the command is running. This may return true even if the command has
445   * just been canceled, as it may not have yet called {@link Command#interrupted()}.
446   *
447   * @return whether or not the command is running
448   */
449  public synchronized boolean isRunning() {
450    return m_running;
451  }
452
453  /**
454   * This will cancel the current command.
455   *
456   * <p>This will cancel the current command eventually. It can be called multiple times. And it can
457   * be called when the command is not running. If the command is running though, then the command
458   * will be marked as canceled and eventually removed.
459   *
460   * <p>A command can not be canceled if it is a part of a command group, you must cancel the
461   * command group instead.
462   *
463   * @throws IllegalUseOfCommandException if this command is a part of a command group
464   */
465  public synchronized void cancel() {
466    if (m_parent != null) {
467      throw new IllegalUseOfCommandException(
468          "Can not manually cancel a command in a command " + "group");
469    }
470    _cancel();
471  }
472
473  /**
474   * This works like cancel(), except that it doesn't throw an exception if it is a part of a
475   * command group. Should only be called by the parent command group.
476   */
477  @SuppressWarnings("MethodName")
478  synchronized void _cancel() {
479    if (isRunning()) {
480      m_canceled = true;
481    }
482  }
483
484  /**
485   * Returns whether or not this has been canceled.
486   *
487   * @return whether or not this has been canceled
488   */
489  public synchronized boolean isCanceled() {
490    return m_canceled;
491  }
492
493  /**
494   * Whether or not this command has completed running.
495   *
496   * @return whether or not this command has completed running.
497   */
498  public synchronized boolean isCompleted() {
499    return m_completed;
500  }
501
502  /**
503   * Returns whether or not this command can be interrupted.
504   *
505   * @return whether or not this command can be interrupted
506   */
507  public synchronized boolean isInterruptible() {
508    return m_interruptible;
509  }
510
511  /**
512   * Sets whether or not this command can be interrupted.
513   *
514   * @param interruptible whether or not this command can be interrupted
515   */
516  protected synchronized void setInterruptible(boolean interruptible) {
517    m_interruptible = interruptible;
518  }
519
520  /**
521   * Checks if the command requires the given {@link Subsystem}.
522   *
523   * @param system the system
524   * @return whether or not the subsystem is required, or false if given null
525   */
526  public synchronized boolean doesRequire(Subsystem system) {
527    return m_requirements.contains(system);
528  }
529
530  /**
531   * Returns the {@link CommandGroup} that this command is a part of. Will return null if this
532   * {@link Command} is not in a group.
533   *
534   * @return the {@link CommandGroup} that this command is a part of (or null if not in group)
535   */
536  public synchronized CommandGroup getGroup() {
537    return m_parent;
538  }
539
540  /**
541   * Sets whether or not this {@link Command} should run when the robot is disabled.
542   *
543   * <p>By default a command will not run when the robot is disabled, and will in fact be canceled.
544   *
545   * @param run whether or not this command should run when the robot is disabled
546   */
547  public void setRunWhenDisabled(boolean run) {
548    m_runWhenDisabled = run;
549  }
550
551  /**
552   * Returns whether or not this {@link Command} will run when the robot is disabled, or if it will
553   * cancel itself.
554   *
555   * @return True if this command will run when the robot is disabled.
556   */
557  public boolean willRunWhenDisabled() {
558    return m_runWhenDisabled;
559  }
560
561  /**
562   * Gets the name of this Command.
563   *
564   * @return Name
565   */
566  public String getName() {
567    return SendableRegistry.getName(this);
568  }
569
570  /**
571   * Sets the name of this Command.
572   *
573   * @param name name
574   */
575  public void setName(String name) {
576    SendableRegistry.setName(this, name);
577  }
578
579  /**
580   * Gets the subsystem name of this Command.
581   *
582   * @return Subsystem name
583   */
584  public String getSubsystem() {
585    return SendableRegistry.getSubsystem(this);
586  }
587
588  /**
589   * Sets the subsystem name of this Command.
590   *
591   * @param subsystem subsystem name
592   */
593  public void setSubsystem(String subsystem) {
594    SendableRegistry.setSubsystem(this, subsystem);
595  }
596
597  /**
598   * The string representation for a {@link Command} is by default its name.
599   *
600   * @return the string representation of this object
601   */
602  @Override
603  public String toString() {
604    return getName();
605  }
606
607  @Override
608  public void initSendable(SendableBuilder builder) {
609    builder.setSmartDashboardType("Command");
610    builder.addStringProperty(".name", this::getName, null);
611    builder.addBooleanProperty(
612        "running",
613        this::isRunning,
614        value -> {
615          if (value) {
616            if (!isRunning()) {
617              start();
618            }
619          } else {
620            if (isRunning()) {
621              cancel();
622            }
623          }
624        });
625    builder.addBooleanProperty(".isParented", this::isParented, null);
626  }
627}
